type_of_incompatibility.dose: - Heparin Sodium 100units/mL + Sildenafil Citrate 800mcg/mL
type_of_incompatibility.reason: Heparin 100 units/mL and sildenafil 800 mcg/mL were physically incompatible in a simulated Y-site study in NS; the solution was instantly cloudy with white precipitate and strands forming and turbidity increased to greater than 0.5 nephelometric turbidity units (NTU), showing incompatibility at room temperature (18 to 22 degrees C); at 37 degrees C, the combination was clear at all timepoints and turbidity was within 0.5 NTU.
